title: Function arguments are not parsed properly
body:
<!--
Thank you for filing a bug report! 🐛 Please provide a short summary of the bug,
along with any information you feel relevant to replicating the bug.
-->

I tried this code:

```rust
struct Pattern(i32);

// Arguments can be given as a pattern
fn pattern_as_arg(Pattern(value): Pattern) -> i32 {
    value
}

fn main() -> i32 {
    pattern_as_arg(Pattern(15)) - 15
}
```

I expected to see this happen: The code compiles

Instead, this happened:
```rust
test.rs:3:27: error: Failed to resolve IdentifierExpr type: ( value ([C: 0 Nid: 23 Hid: 32]))
    3 | fn pattern_as_arg(Pattern(value): Pattern) -> i32 {
      |                           ^
test.rs:4:5: error: failed to type resolve expression
    4 |     value
      |     ^
test.rs:3:1: error: expected [i32] got [<tyty::error>]
    3 | fn pattern_as_arg(Pattern(value): Pattern) -> i32 {
      | ^                                             ~
```

Per the reference, function parameters are patterns:
https://doc.rust-lang.org/reference/items/functions.html
> FunctionParameters :
      SelfParam ,?
   | (SelfParam ,)? FunctionParam (, FunctionParam)* ,?
>
> ...
>
> FunctionParam :
   [OuterAttribute](https://doc.rust-lang.org/reference/attributes.html)* ( FunctionParamPattern | ... | [Type](https://doc.rust-lang.org/reference/types.html#type-expressions) [2](https://doc.rust-lang.org/reference/items/functions.html#fn-param-2015) )
>
> FunctionParamPattern :
   [PatternNoTopAlt](https://doc.rust-lang.org/reference/patterns.html) : ( [Type](https://doc.rust-lang.org/reference/types.html#type-expressions) | ... )
   
[And the link that PatternNoTopAlt points to](https://doc.rust-lang.org/reference/patterns.html)

gccrs commit: 865b6090a8f8981cdfc050ea2ee44abbe92de141
